executive_summary: The farmers markets industry has seen revenue growth at an expected CAGR of 7.5% over the five years to 2024, when revenue is set to reach $1.4 billion. While per capita consumption of fruits and vegetables has declined during the same period, the prices of key industry products have increased, facilitating industry growth. Farmers markets were able to see continued growth in 2020 as they were able to accommodate COVID-19 related safety measures.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Farmers Markets Adapted to the COVID-19 Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Farmers markets were easily adapted to suit COVID-19 safety restrictions, as they are often in large outdoor spaces, which were more conducive to social distancing. The inflationary environment seen in recent years partially stems from the pandemic and is contributing to rising fruit and vegetable prices, which are driving industry revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Prices of Fruit and Vegetables Has Rose
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In recent years, both the price of fruit and the price of vegetables have seen strong growth, driving revenue growth. Both drought conditions and inflationary pressures have contributed to rising fruit and vegetable costs. Rising per capita income and rising fish and poultry consumption have contributed to industry revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Per Capita Fruit and Vegetable Consumption Has Fallen Slightly
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Per capita fruit and vegetable consumption has fallen recent years, tempering revenue growth. Increased prices have drove the decline in per capita fruit and vegetable consumption, but a general shift towards health consciousness and away from meat consumption has dampened the decline in consumption.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Price and Consumption Trends are Expected to be Mixed
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The price of vegetables is expected to continue to see growth in coming years, though at a slower rate. This should continue to drive revenue growth. Still, the price of vegetables is set to fall, having the opposite effect. Per capita fruit and vegetable consumption is set to continue its decline in coming years, dampening projected revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Social Trends are in Favor of the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Broad social trends are in favor of fruit and vegetable consumption, including a shift away from meat eating. Government programs, including SNAP benefits and school lunches will continue to drive growth in overall fruit and vegetable consumption. Many farmers markets accept EBT payments, and some local governments further subsidize purchases at farmers markets.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry provide a space for local farms and craftsman to sell produce, vegetables and other agricultural products.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Price of vegetables
threats: Per capita fruit and vegetable consumption

key_trends: The farmers market industry has seen revenue growth in recent years. This has been partially due to rising prices of fruits and vegetables being passed along to consumers, resulting in higher revenue.
Farmers markets were able to see revenue growth in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The markets were better able to accommodate safety measures.
Vendors that sell their products at farmers' markets experience different regulations than other vendors. They often do not need permits to sell their products.

Farmers markets don't have to adhere to the same packaging, labeling, size and grading standards as other vendors. However, farmers' markets must be certified by the Agricultural Commissioner and operated by a local government, certified producer or an independent association.
Consumers account for the majority of demand for farmers markets. Older consumers tend to be more health conscious and have greater disposable income.

market_segmentation.segment: Older Consumers are Bigger Markets for Farmers
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment accounts for farmers markets' sales to consumers of all ages. Consumers under 25 account for less industry demand than other cohorts as they tend to have less disposable income and adolescents in particular tend to have less healthy diets. Consumers aged 55 and older tend to be more health conscious, have more disposable income and may have more free time to go to farmers markets than younger cohorts.

market_segmentation.segment: Retailers, Wholesalers and Businesses Make Use of Farmers Markets
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment accounts for demand from wholesalers for resale, retailers for resale, businesses for end use and other.

market_segmentation.segment: Businesses for end use and other

products_and_services.product_description: This segment accounts for sales of a wide variety of vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, lettuce and broccoli, either fresh or packaged. Frozen vegetables are included in the other segment.

This segment accounts for sales of a variety of fruits, including but not limited to apples, grapes, citrus fruits, pears and many others types of fruits. Frozen fruits are included in the other segment.
This segment includes the sale of products including meat, seafood, poultry, dry goods, frozen foods and a variety of other products.

Fruit & Vegetable Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Fruit & Vegetable Markets in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment accounts for sales of a wide variety of vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, lettuce and broccoli, either fresh or packaged. Frozen vegetables are included in the other segment.

This segment accounts for sales of a variety of fruits, including but not limited to apples, grapes, citrus fruits, pears and many others types of fruits. Frozen fruits are included in the other segment.
This segment includes the sale of products including meat, seafood, poultry, dry goods, frozen foods and a variety of other products.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region of the United States.
The Mid-Atlantic region of the United States.
The New England region of the United States.

The Rocky Mountains region of the United States.

The West region of the United States.

basis_points.basis_description: Barriers to entry to the farmers market industry are low. They involve purchasing or producing goods and differentiating from other players in the industry.
Buyer and supplier power is moderate in the farmers market industry. Buyers often have cheaper grocery options while suppliers are often the same people as those selling at markets.
The farmers market industry is not very concentrated. Most markets operate on a local level and many operate independently, keeping concentration low.
There are a wide variety of substitutes to farmers markets. Most items sold at farmers markets have a close substitute found in grocery stores or online.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the industry's leading cost
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Similar to most food retailing industries, purchase costs represent the bulk of the industry's expenses. As a percentage of an average operator's revenue, this category has remained relatively stable during the current period as the rising costs of fruits and vegetables have been passed along to consumers in the form of higher prices.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low. This is combined with a low concentration of innovation. Both factors being low suggests that new technology entry is slow and widespread, which limits the threat of disruptive threats hurting leading industry operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Prices of Fruits and Vegetables and Consumer Demand
volatility_points.volatility_description: The prices of the industry's products, such as fruit, vegetables and seafood, have increased. As many merchants are also farmers themselves, weather conditions have an effect on industry revenue. If heavy rainfall or lack of rain causes production to drop, limited produce stocks and poor quality may damage sales and raise prices. The sharp changes in price and a relatively small decline in consumption demonstrates that other factors, such as consumers' health consciousness, help keep demand fairly stable, even when prices rise. Due to the low volatility of demand, changes in prices end up bolstering revenue volatility for the industry.

FAQs.question: What is the revenue volatility of the industry?
FAQs.answer: The revenue volatility is described as MODERATE.

FAQs.question: How are prices of fruits and vegetables affecting consumer demand?
FAQs.answer: The prices of the industry's products, such as fruit, vegetables and seafood, have increased. As many merchants are also farmers themselves, weather conditions have an effect on industry revenue. If heavy rainfall or lack of rain causes production to drop, limited produce stocks and poor quality may damage sales and raise prices. The sharp changes in price and a relatively small decline in consumption demonstrates that other factors, such as consumers' health consciousness, help keep demand fairly stable, even when prices rise. Due to the low volatility of demand, changes in prices end up bolstering revenue volatility for the industry.

FAQs.question: What is the level of regulation in the industry?
FAQs.answer: The regulation is described as MODERATE and STEADY.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The industry assistance is described as LOW and STEADY.
